properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat event is expected through Thursday. Daytime high temperatures in the low thirties on Wednesday and Thursday with overnight lows near 18 degrees Celsius are expected. This heat event may be extended into the weekend with daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-01T21:09:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-01T05:10:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1017836195.2020
Area: Greater Sudbury and vicinity, Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake, Chapleau - Missinaibi Lake, Gogama - Foleyet, West Nipissing - French River, North Bay - Powassan - Mattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat event continues through Thursday. Daytime high temperatures in the low thirties with overnight lows near 18 degrees Celsius are expected to continue until Thursday. Cooler air will move into the region Thursday night. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the air quality health index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-01T21:25:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-01T05:26:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0736445372.2020
Area: Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long duration heat event continues. Daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the mid to high thirties, are expected for the foreseeable future. Overnight lows near 18 degrees Celsius will provide little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-01T21:15:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-01T05:16:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2902123634.2020

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and frequent lightning. Hazards: - Thunderstorm wind gusts to 40 knots - Small hail Timing: Late this evening through the overnight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-01T11:29:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-01T04:48:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2026497502.2020
Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 60 knots. A cold front will track across southern Manitoba tonight. A line of strong thunderstorms will accompany this front and produce very strong wind gusts that may reach 60 knots. These storms are likely over Lake Manitoba and southern Lake Winnipeg this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-01T09:24:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-01T01:09:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0925730645.2020
Area: Lake Winnipeg - south basin, Lake Manitoba
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 36 are expected for the next 3 days. A heat event will continue today. Daytime high temperatures near or in the low thirties will continue today. Cooler air will move into the region Wednesday night. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-01T21:12:57-00:00

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. Rain will ease through the day Thursday. Total rainfall is expected to be in the 50 to 70 mm range. However, local amounts could be near 90 mm. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-01T19:53:59-00:00
